Highlight a pattern sequence in a vector

Source: R/utilities.R
highlight_pattern.Rd

The function highlights a pattern (e.g., "UAG") in a vector by putting a replacement (e.g., an underscore _) in all characters that don't match the sequence

highlight_pattern(x, pattern, replacement = "_", verbose = TRUE)

Arguments

x

A character vector.
pattern

A character vector indicating the pattern to highlight
replacement

A replacement to replace all the characters that do not match the pattern with.

Value

A list with the location and highlighted pattern.

Examples

x <- rand_nuc_seq(n = 50, seed = 1)
#> Start codon  : 2-4
#> Stop codon   : TAA
#> Position stop: 32-34
x
#> [1] "AATGTACCTTCCAAATTTTCACAAAATAATTTAACAGCTTTTCGGGTGAC"
highlight_pattern(x, pattern = "CCA")
#> ============ Location ============
#>   pattern start end
#> 1     CCA    11  13
#> ----------------------------------
#> __________CCA_____________________________________

# or a vector
highlight_pattern(x, pattern = c("CCA", "GTA"))
#> ============ Location ============
#>   pattern start end
#> 1     CCA    11  13
#> 2     GTA     4   6
#> ----------------------------------
#> ___GTA____CCA_____________________________________

# vectorized

x2 <-  rand_nuc_seq(n = 50, seed = 2)
#> Start codon  : 2-4
#> Stop codon   : TGA
#> Position stop: 14-16
x2
#> [1] "AATGGGAAAGAATTGATGGTCCCGCATAGGCTATGGATGTCACGAATTTC"
highlight_pattern(c(x, x2), pattern = "ATG")
#> ============ Location ============
#>   pattern start end
#> 1     ATG     2   4
#> ----------------------------------
#> _ATG______________________________________________
#> ============ Location ============
#>   pattern start end
#> 1     ATG     2   4
#> 2     ATG    16  18
#> 3     ATG    33  35
#> 4     ATG    37  39
#> ----------------------------------
#> _ATG___________ATG______________ATG_ATG___________
